Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which the company was on the brink of bankruptcy.
Falters at times: The claim may falter at times by not providing enough specific evidence or details to support the turnaround.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough support in terms of specific data or financial information to demonstrate the success of the turnaround.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the turnaround was solely due to "common-sense business principles" without considering other possible factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the turnaround may have been influenced by the acquisition of Godfather's Pizza as part of a larger deal with Burger King franchises.
